title: Monro is as good as any; there is also a Loeb Library edition with facing English translation by A
On Translating Homer
A great poet discusses the style of Homer and criticises some attempts at translation
The World of Odysseus
A readable account of the sociology of the Odyssey
Early Greek Poetry and Philosophy
The section on Homer contains many interesting insights
Brings out the uniqueness of the Homeric treatment of central aspects of human life
The Songs of Homer
A full discussion of the poems from the point of view of oral poetry
The Justice of Zeus
Homeric ideas about the justice of the gods are put in the context of later Greek developments
The Rise of the Greek Epic
Imaginative and lively account of the creation of the poems and their setting

note: Exciting (if rather one-sidedly 'Apollonian') account of the gods as conceived in early Greece.
title: The Homeric Gods, translated by Hadas
*The Iliad, Poem of Might* in Intimations of Christianity Among the Ancient Greeks
A brilliantly suggestive essay on the Iliad and its pictiure of human suffering
